question:
You are a math expert. When you respond, respond only with the Solution of the final Problem, thinking step by step. At the end of the Solution, when you give your final answer, write it in the form 'Final Answer: \\boxed{$answer$}. I hope it is correct.'
If $\begin{vmatrix} a & b \\ c & d \end{vmatrix} = -8,$ then find
\[\begin{vmatrix} b & a \\ d & c \end{vmatrix}.\]
inference:
The determinant of a 2x2 matrix $\begin{pmatrix} a & b \\ c & d \end{pmatrix}$ is $ad - bc$. We are given that $\begin{vmatrix} a & b \\ c & d \end{vmatrix} = -8.$
We have $ad - bc = -8$.
We want to find $\begin{vmatrix} b & a \\ d & c \end{vmatrix}$.
The determinant of the matrix $\begin{pmatrix} b & a \\ d & c \end{pmatrix}$ is $bc - ad$.
Since $ad - bc = -8$, then $bc - ad = -(ad - bc) = -(-8) = 8$.
Final Answer: $\boxed{8}$
ground_truth:
Since $\begin{vmatrix} a & b \\ c & d \end{vmatrix} = -8,$ $ad - bc = -8.$  Then
\[\begin{vmatrix} b & a \\ d & c \end{vmatrix} = bc - ad = \boxed{8}.\](Why does this make sense geometrically?)
